subject: Climate & Environment
title: Warmer Air, Heavier Rain
description: A 60-second lesson on Warmer Air, Heavier Rain.

hook.text: For every degree Celsius of warming, the atmosphere holds 7% more moisture. The math is simple.

buildup.text: More moisture means storms drop heavier rain. What was a 1-in-100-year event becomes 1-in-20.

discovery.text: Hurricane Harvey dumped 1.5 meters of rain on Houston in 2017 â€” a record for any US storm.

twist.text: Scientists found climate change made Harvey's rainfall 15% heavier and 3 times more likely.

climax.text: Cities designed for historical rainfall are flooding under storms their drains can't handle.

punchline.text: Warmer air is a bigger sponge â€” and it wrings out harder.
